required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of AZD3043
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I, Single-Centre, Open Label Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of Intravenous AZD3043 After Single Ascending Doses in Healthy Male Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase I, single centre, open label study to assess the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics (PK) and pharmacodynamics of intravenous AZD3043 after single ascending doses in healthy male volunteers.

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Vital signs data, heart rate, electrocardiogram (ECG)
primary_outcome.time_frame: The measure will be taken between -20 to 150 min relative to start of administration of AZD3043.

primary_outcome.measure: Respiratory signs data (SpO2, EtCO2, PaO2, blood gases, respiratory frequency, volume and pattern, occurrence of apnoea;
primary_outcome.time_frame: The measure will be taken between -20 to 150 min relative to start of administration of AZD3043.

secondary_outcome.measure: PK parameters for AZD3043: Cmax (Css), AUClast, AUC, lz, t½lz, CL, Vc, Vss, Vz, tlast and mean residence time in arterial and venous plasma.
PK parameters for the metabolite (THRX 108893): Cmax (Css), AUClast, AUC, tmax, tlast, lz and t½lz in venous plasma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 29 min, 45 min and 150 min post dose

intervention.description: intravenous solution given once as intravenous infusion over 30 minutes

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy male subjects aged 18 to 45 years with suitable veins for cannulation or repeated venepuncture
- Pre-dose assessment judged without remarks by the investigator
- Have a Body Mass Index (BMI) between 19 and 30 kg/m2 and weight at least 50kg and no more than 100kg
Exclusion Criteria:
- After adequate time (at least 15 minutes) of rest in supine position, abnormal vital signs defined as any of the following:·
- Systolic blood pressure (BP) >140 mm Hg.·
- Diastolic BP >90 mm Hg.
- Heart rate <=55 or >85 beats per minute
- Subjects with compromised airway or respiratory function as evidenced by the presence of Class 3 or 4 Airway, Sleep Apnoea, Neck circumference > 16.5 inches (42 cm), Asthma, Active or recent (2 weeks) respiratory infection, or known chronic respiratory infection, or known chronic respirator
- Lack of a normal phenotype for butyrylcholinesterase (pseudo-cholinesterase)

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Clinical Science Intervention and technology, CLINTECThe department of Anaesthosiology and Intensive care, Karolinska University hospital, Huddinge,141 86 Stockholm, Sweden
